oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Raymond B. Witt correspondence with Horace J. Traylor, 1966 June 29
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Witt, Raymond B., 1915-2000
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from attorney Raymond Witt to Horace J. Traylor, president of the Chattanooga Community Action Program, discussing the ramifications of desegregation in Chattanooga's Headstart program.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Segregation in education -- Law and legislation; Segregation in education -- Tennessee --Chattanooga
Chattanooga (Tenn.). Board of Education; United States. District Court (Tennessee: Eastern Division)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Mapp v. Board of Education correspondence, 1965-1967
Chattanooga Board of Education records and correspondence, 1965-1969
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Raymond B. Witt Chattanooga Public Schools desegregation records
